name: The Adventures of Tree
description: The Adventures of Tree takes you on an open ended adventure to save your fellow species from the evil invaders! Explore the vast open world to discover it's many secrets! With over 30+ hours of gameplay, The Adventures of Tree, is not something you'll want to miss out on!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: 1.6 Ghz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: 256MB DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 3 GB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 8.1 Processor: 1.6 Ghz Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: 512MB DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 3 GB available space

reviews.review_text: I gave this game a fair try. I wanted to like it and I did for a bit, that is until the lack of UI polish and bugs began jumping out at me more and more the longer I played. The worst being the lag from the bee hive bug which basically makes the game unplayable. The load screen is also desperately long. like several minutes long, even on a high end gaming machine. I think its a simple and fun light hearted game, or it would be if it worked. However I cannot recomend this game in this state. I hope they fix it, when they learn how to code better.

I reported a bug. The Developer responded and released a patch for my issue on the very same day. How's that for product support??!!  Buy this game and support small developers!!  Oh, and, it's fun, hilarious, easy to play and has good music.

Looks and sounds like a game made by a twelve year old, but it's not. It has a layer of adultness just under the surface and surprisingly has decent gameplay. The world is bizarrely rich with character and creativity. An absurd amount of thought was put into this game and if you spend an hour, it just might grip you.  Unfortunately, it's not great under the hood. Missing character sprites, broken quests that required starting a new game to fix, poor introduction and steep learning curve, a lack of some basic features such as quest navigation, spelling mistakes and the occasional CTD.  It wasn't the kindest experience, but it was actually interesting to me for far longer than I expected.
This game is fun to get, if you buy it in a bundle, but to expensive on its own.
This is an interesting game from a certain point of view. I enjoyed playing it, does have a special graphic and game mechanics, the overall sound is okay. Keeps you entertained and satisfied.
